title: Business (Short Stay) visa (subclass 456)
summary: This page provides information about the closed Business (Short Stay) visa (subclass 456). It explains when the visa was discontinued, which visas replaced it, and what rights and obligations applied to existing visa holders. It also outlines permitted activities, work restrictions, and requirements for updating changes in personal circumstances.

alternative_for_business_visitors.purpose: Short business visits without work intentions

how_long_visa_lasts.notification_method: Specified in the Notification of Grant letter

length_of_stay.duration: maximum of three months per visit

exceptions: Work usually less than six weeks for the life of the visa

no_further_stay_condition.implications: Cannot apply for any other visa while in Australia except for a Protection visa

general_obligations: Comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws
Not undertake formal study or training leading to a primary, secondary, or higher education qualification
work_restrictions: Not work in Australia except under very limited circumstances
Not perform work that can be done by an Australian citizen or Australian permanent resident
Not perform activities other than those stated in the visa application

changes_to_report: Changes to phone number, email, address, or passport
change_notification_requirements.consequences_of_not_reporting_new_passpo: Possible significant delays at the airport and potential denial of permission to board a plane
